title: Micro Frontends with Angular
subject: Angular
theory: Micro Frontends split a monolithic frontend into smaller, independent applications that run together. Angular 12+ supports Webpack Module Federation, making it easier to load remote Angular modules into a shell app at runtime.

common_mistakes.correction: All micro-frontends should ideally share the same Angular version/dependencies to avoid loading multiple frameworks.

interview_questions.question: What is Module Federation?
interview_questions.answer: A Webpack 5 feature allowing a JavaScript application to dynamically load code from another application at runtime.

real_world_use_cases.description: Team Checkout deploys independently from Team Search. The Shell app stitches them together.

summary: Micro Frontends scale development across multiple teams but introduce significant architectural complexity.
